critique: This executive order pertains to military citations and awards for outstanding performance in action, including units of co-belligerent nations. It outlines the authorization for Secretaries of the Army, Navy, and Air Force to issue citations, the display of insignia, and the wearing of ribbons by personnel. There is nothing about Ideological Tilt, Immigration Approach, Executive Power, Federalism, National Security vs. Civil Liberties, Economic Regulation, or Social Inclusion in this document.
